intro: Lavandula officinalis f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered lavender, is a cultivar of the common lavender plant. It is characterized by its pale to white flowers, which contrast with the typical purple hues of the species. This variety is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant is widely cultivated for its aromatic foliage and flowers, which are used in perfumery and herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and essential oil production.
